Bounds¶

class decodes.core.dc_bounds.Bounds(**kargs)¶

Bases: decodes.core.dc_base.Geometry

A 2d retangular or 3d cubic boudary class axis are oriented to world axes

__init__(**kargs)¶

a Bounds may be constructed two ways: By setting “center”, “dim_x”, “dim_y”, and optionally “dim_z” OR by setting “ival_x”, “ival_y”, and optionally “ival_z”

corners¶

moves counter clockwise, like so: (-,-)(+,-)(+,+)(-,+)

cpt¶
dim_x¶
dim_y¶
dim_z¶
static encompass(pts=[pt[0,0,0]])¶
eval(x, y, z=0)¶
is_2d¶
is_3d¶
near_pt(p)¶

Returns the closest point to this Bounds. If the point in within the bounds, simply returns the point

overlaps(other)¶
subbounds(divs)¶

produces subboundaries. starts at bottom left, moves from left to right and then bottom to top.

to_polyline()¶
static unit_cube()¶
